intro: Restio colliculospermus, commonly known as the knobbed restio, is a perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to fire-prone environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white flowers. It typically grows in coastal or sandy habitats and is often found in fynbos vegetation. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
